Description: White glazed composition kohl-tube: reproducing the form of a reed. The design, composed of a garland of lotus petals toward the top and a zone of diaper pattern below, is in brown paint on a white background.
Curator's comments: Bibliography: H. R. Hall, ‘Objects of Tutankhamun in the British Museum’ in ‘ Journal of Egyptian Archaeology’ 14 (London, 1928), p. 74, no. 2, pl. 9: 1; 'Les amour d'une princesse égyptienne' (Saint-Gérard, 1997), p.122 [89].
Bibliographic references: Museum of Fine Arts Boston 1982 / Egypt's Golden Age: The Art of Living in the New Kingdom 1558-1085 BC (275)
Exhibition history: Exhibited: 1982 Feb-May, Boston, Museum of Fine Arts, Egypt's Golden Age 1982 Jul-Sep, Houston, Houston Museum of Natural Science, Egypt's Golden Age 1982/3 Oct-Jan, Baltimore, Walters Art Gallery, Egypt's Golden Age 1997 May-Oct, Abbaye Saint-Gerard De Brogne, Le Roman de la momie
Acquisition name: Purchased from: Capt Edward G Spencer-Churchill (Trustees of)
